main event: A bright light in the southern sky was observed in Evansville, Indiana on March 6, 1960.
interesting points: The light was reported to be stationary and not judged for size., The observation lasted 3-5 minutes., There were no follow-up questions issued due to insufficient information., Many people in Evansville reported seeing the light, but no official confirmation was available., A military flight reported seeing a similar bright flashing light over the area shortly after.
sighted object: bright light in the southern sky
witness description: Various observers in the area around the time of sighting.
